notes:
1. Three-Phase Systems

Three-phase power is a common method of AC electric power generation, transmission, and distribution. It consists of three separate AC voltages of the same frequency and amplitude, but with a 120° phase shift between each one.

2. Balanced Load

A balanced load is one in which the impedance in each of the three phases is identical. Large three-phase motors are a common example of a balanced load. When the load is balanced, the currents drawn by each phase are equal in magnitude and are also 120° out of phase with each other.

3. Load Connections

Three-phase loads can be connected in two ways:

  • Wye (Y) or Star Connection: The three phase impedances are connected at a common central point (the neutral point).
  • Delta ($\Delta$) Connection: The three phase impedances are connected in a closed loop, like a triangle.

4. Line and Phase Quantities

It is important to distinguish between line and phase quantities:

  • Line Voltage ($V_L$): The voltage between any two of the three lines.
  • Phase Voltage ($V_\phi$): The voltage across a single phase of the load.
  • Line Current ($I_L$): The current flowing in any one of the three lines.
  • Phase Current ($I_\phi$): The current flowing through a single phase of the load.

For a balanced system:

  • Wye Connection: $V_L = \sqrt{3} V_\phi$ and $I_L = I_\phi$.
  • Delta Connection: $V_L = V_\phi$ and $I_L = \sqrt{3} I_\phi$.

solvedExamples.question: In a balanced, three-phase, wye-connected load, the line voltage is 480 V. What is the phase voltage?
solvedExamples.explanation: For a wye connection, the relationship is $V_L = \sqrt{3} V_\phi$. Rearranging gives $V_\phi = V_L / \sqrt{3} = 480 / \sqrt{3} \approx 277$ V.

solvedExamples.question: In a balanced, three-phase, delta-connected load, the phase current is 10 A. What is the line current?
solvedExamples.explanation: For a delta connection, the relationship is $I_L = \sqrt{3} I_\phi$. So, $I_L = \sqrt{3} \times 10 \text{ A} \approx 17.3$ A.
